* Rebecca Hill, Libellant, versus David Hill. In a libel for a divorce a mensd et thora, the Court do not require evidence of the marriage unless denied by the respondent. Threats of violence, without actual assault, are no ground for a divorce a mensd et thora. This was a libel for a divorce a mensd et thora, for extreme cruelty in the husband. Ellis, for the libellant,

offered a certificate of the marriage of the parties.

Curia.

In a libel for a divorce from bed and board only, you nave no occasion to prove a marriage, unless it be denied.

The evidence in support of the charge of cruelty was only of abusive and threatening language.

Curia. Threats of violence, without an actual assault, are not a legal cause for divorce, (a) The wife’s remedy in such case is by exhibiting articles of the peace against her husband.

The divorce was refused.
